Class HW2

  • java.lang.Object
    • HW2

  • public class HW2
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the singular class for the second project in the spring of 2024 for CSDS132. The methods included are the ones required on the instructions as well as one 'helper' method to remove leading and trailing spaces. The helper method is private, but all other methods are public and have their own javadoc. I was only allowed to use the methods in the API listed below:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      HW2()

    • Method Detail

      • samePrefix

        public static boolean samePrefix(java.lang.String stringOne,
                                 java.lang.String stringTwo,
                                 int compareStr)
        Asserts whether the first 'compareStr' values of a string are equal to each other. This is case sensitive, and if the desired int value exceeds the length of either string, then the result is false.
        Parameters:
        stringOne - The first desired string to use in comparison with the second
        stringTwo - The string to be compared with the first string inputted
        compareStr - An int that represents the amount of characters in the string to compare
        Returns:
        A boolean value that represents whether or not the first 'compareStr' values of the strings are equivalent

      • matchingParentheses

        public static boolean matchingParentheses(java.lang.String statement)
        Asserts whether or not parentheses in an input are matched, meaning that every string with parenthesis should have exactly one open parentheses '(' for every closed parentheses ')'. False is only returned if parentheses are mismatched.
        Parameters:
        statement - A statement as a string with or without parentheses that will be examined to determine if its parentheses are matched correctly
        Returns:
        A boolean value asserting whether the parentheses in the string are matched correctly

      • removeEveryKthWord

        public static java.lang.String removeEveryKthWord(java.lang.String sentence,
                                                  int k)
        Changes an inputted string by removing the 'k'th word in the string plus the whitespace to the right of the world. This is repeated until the string is no longer able to be changed, essentially removing every 'k'th word in the string. Non-positive inputs for the int will return the original string.
        Parameters:
        sentence - A sentence or generic string that will be sifted through in this method
        k - An int corresponding to the the 'k'th word from the string that will be returned
        Returns:
        A new, modified string with every 'k'th word missing, assuming k is a positive integer

      • flipEachK

        public static java.lang.String flipEachK(java.lang.String statement,
                                         int k)
        Changes an inputted string such that the first 'k'th characters in the string are not altered, but the next 'k'th characters are flipped. This means that the flipped characters will start with the 'k'th characters in the group and end with its original starting character. If the integer inputted exceeds the length of the string, then the string remains unchanged. Every 'k' group of characters will be in the order: unchanged, flipped, etc.
        Parameters:
        statement - A string that is the desired string to be altered by the method
        k - An int that represents the 'k'th number of characters to keep the same, then rotate, then repeat
        Returns:
        A string that contains the exact same characters as the input string, just in a new order

      • reverseDigits

        public static java.lang.String reverseDigits(java.lang.String statement)
        Potentially changes an inputted string such that any present digits are reordered in reverse order. Regardless of the other characters in the string, the numbers 0-9 will be reordered in reverse order, remaining in the same indices.
        Parameters:
        statement - A string that potentially contains numbers. It will be altered by the method if numbers are present, and will remain untouched if not.
        Returns:
        A potentially altered string that is identical to the input except the digits present are in reverse order.

      • replaceText

        public static java.lang.String replaceText(java.lang.String baseString,
                                           java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces substrings of an inputted string, indicated by parentheses (...) with substrings from another string using the same nomenclature. If the first string contains more substrings than the second, they are removed. If the second string contains more substrings than the first, then they are ignored. Mismatched parentheses will be ignored in a way that they are still included in the output, but are not considered for replacement. Substrings are replaced in the exact same order as they appeared originally.
        Parameters:
        baseString - A string with zero or more indicated substrings to be replaced
        replacement - A string with indicated substrings that will replace those indicated in the baseString
        Returns:
        A string that is an altered version of the baseString with the substrings replaced in the manner indicated above.

      • reverseAll

        public static java.lang.String reverseAll(java.lang.String originalString)
        Flips every single substring inside of an inputted string. Substrings are indicated by characters inside of matched parentheses (...). This behavior is observed for nested substrings as well. If a reversed substring contains another substring, then it will then be reserved. Parentheses must be properly matched in order to work properly, so an error is thrown if this is not the case.
        Parameters:
        originalString - A string with zero or more substrings to be altered by this method
        Returns:
        An altered originalString where all substrings are flipped in the manner described above.
